intro: Bupleurum salicifolium var. lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Asia, including China and the Russian Far East. It features slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a serrated margin. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
